intro: Echioides rubra, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. Echioides rubra is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping.
